name: 陳岡伯
objective:
本課程以當代文學批評和文化理論為基礎，探討小說與戲劇改編成電影的過程中，文字轉化成視覺意象之間的差異，期能提升多元化的思辯及表達能力。
Drawing upon modern literary criticism and cultural theory, this course aims to examine the difference between works of literature and the distinctive medium of the cinema. Students will be offered a variety of discussion which stimulates the kinds of critical thinking that lead to a better understanding of the process of transposition from literature to film.

The course follows the history of Western literature, approaching representative literary works from Classical antiquity, Renaissance, the Enlightenment, the Romantic Period and the nineteenth century, to the modern time. Students will watch films related to or adapted from the literary texts, after which the instructor will give a lecture and conduct in-class discussion. By the end of the semester, the students will be familiarized with the key ideas of each important literary era or movement and formulate their own critical interpretations of literature and its visualization.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to the course

Week 2-3: Greek Mythology
Film viewing: Troy (2004)
Literary text: Homer's The Iliad

Week 4-6: Shakespeare and Renaissance literature
Film viewing: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
Literary text: William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and sonnets (18, 73, 116, 138)

Week 7-8: the Enlightenment and Revolution
FIlm viewing: Quills (2000)
Literary text: Marquis de Sade's Justine, or the Misfortunes of Virtue

Week 9: Mid-term exam (Identifications and short answers)

Week 10-12: Romanticism
Film viewing: Byron (2003)
Literary text: A selection of Romantic poetry

Week 13-15: Mystery fiction
Film viewing: Episodes from Sherlock (2011)
Literary text: Conan Doyle’s stories

Week 16-17: The monstrous and modern horror 
Film viewing: Alien (1979) or The Silence of the Lamb (1991)
Critical essay: to be decided

Week 18: Group presentations
